Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery grooved vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394233) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394233)
